div.p: These panels illustrate drilldown behavior in tables. The first row of panels illustrate the default drilldown behavior, which is the same as if Row drilldown behavior is specified. The second row shows two ways to turn off drilldown behavior. The bottom panel show how to implement cell-based drilldown.

li.p:
Row
A click on a row launches a drilldown search on the x-axis value (the value in the first column of the table) for the row.

Cell
A click on a cell launces a drilldown search on both the x-axis and y-axis values for the cell.
The y-axis value does not come into play in all cell drilldown searches. Cell-click interactions work best with tables and charts generated by searches containing a "split by" clause. Cell clicks in charts based on reporting commands, such as timechart max(eps) min(eps) avg(eps) always behave like row clicks. These type of tables should always be configured for row-click drilldown, which is less confusing for users of the table.

Off | None
Two ways to disable drilldown behavior.
